{"step_by_step_thinking": "The maxillary first molar is a tooth in the human dentition. It typically has three roots: two buccal roots (towards the cheek) and one palatal root (towards the palate). Each of these roots typically contains one canal, but the mesiobuccal root often contains two canals, making a total of four canals.", "answer_choice": "B. 3 roots and 4 canals"}
